question: It is true that the 4R concept stands for Reduce, Reuse, Recycle, and Recover.
It is false that 'Reduce' means increasing the amount of waste we produce.
Reusing old items instead of throwing them away helps in waste reduction.
Using a refillable water bottle instead of a single-use plastic bottle is an example of recycling.
Printing documents on both sides of paper helps in reducing waste.
Recovering energy from waste materials is not a part of the 4R concept.
Recycling means processing waste materials to create new products.
Composting food waste is an example of the 'Recover' principle.
Plastic bottles cannot be recycled into new plastic products.
Donating old clothes instead of discarding them follows the 'Reuse' principle.
Using rechargeable batteries instead of disposable ones is an example of 'Recover'.
Recycling helps in conserving natural resources.
Waste-to-energy plants convert waste into useful electricity.
Recycling requires more energy than creating new products from raw materials.
Metal cans cannot be recycled after use.
'Reduce' means producing more waste to manage effectively.
Extracting valuable materials from old electronics is an example of 'Recover'.
Using a cloth bag instead of a plastic bag is an example of the 'Reduce' principle.
Burning waste is always a good method for waste management.
Using old newspapers to wrap gifts instead of buying wrapping paper is an example of 'Reuse'.
